title: Han Jinming
text:
Han Jinming (; born 28 February 1969) is a Chinese <a href="association%20football">football</a> coach and a former international <a href="Midfielder%20%28association%20football%29">midfielder</a> who played for <a href="China%20national%20football%20team">China</a> in the <a href="1996%20Asian%20Cup">1996 Asian Cup</a>. While in his club career his representation of <a href="Tianjin%20Teda%20F.C.">Tianjin Sumsang</a> saw him captain the team from 1993 until 1996 before leaving for <a href="Chongqing%20Lifan%20F.C.">Qianwei Huandao</a> and <a href="Yunnan%20Hongta%20F.C.">Yunnan Hongta</a> where he was forced to retire due to serious injury in 2000.
Playing career.
Han Jinming started his career in 1987 playing for the <a href="Tianjin%20Teda%20F.C.">Tianjin youth team</a> who were allowed to take part in the Chinese league pyramid. He was soon called up to the <a href="China%20PR%20national%20under-23%20football%20team">Chinese under-23 team</a> who were also allowed to take part in the <a href="Chinese%20Jia-A%20League%201990">1990 Chinese league</a> pyramid. Upon his return he was promoted to the senior team of Tianjin where he became their captain in 1993 as well as breaking into the senior <a href="China%20national%20football%20team">Chinese national team</a>, whom he represented at the <a href="1996%20Asian%20Cup">1996 Asian Cup</a>. After the tournament Han joined <a href="Chongqing%20Lifan%20F.C.">Qianwei Huandao</a> and <a href="Yunnan%20Hongta%20F.C.">Yunnan Hongta</a> before returning to Tianjin for a brief period before he had to retire due to injury.
Management career.
After he retired in 2000 Han immediately moved into youth management in <a href="Tianshui">Tianshui</a>, <a href="Gansu">Gansu</a> where he impressed the <a href="Chinese%20Football%20Association">Chinese Football Association</a> who offered him a job as a scout and training lecturer for them. In 2007 Han received his first management job at <a href="Hohhot%20Binhai">Hohhot Binhai</a>, however this only lasted for one season.
